body.p: As a consequence of the amendment described in paragraph BC315A, the Board also:

li.p: amended IFRS 17 to require an entity that has entered into a reinsurance contract held to recognise the related group of reinsurance contracts held when the entity recognises onerous underlying insurance contracts, if that is earlier than the date the entity would otherwise recognise the group of reinsurance contracts held (see paragraphs 62‒62A of IFRS 17).
added requirements to IFRS 17 relating to recovery of losses from a reinsurance contract held:
in a transfer of insurance contracts that do not form a business and in a business combination within the scope of IFRS 3 (see paragraphs B95B‒B95D of IFRS 17); and
in applying IFRS 17 for the first time (see paragraphs C16A‒C16C and C20A‒C20B of IFRS 17).
